alert.note: Alert for Bracken (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN BRACKEN, CLERMONT AND SOUTHWESTERN BROWN COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 347 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Bethel, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Amelia, Mount Orab, Bethel, New Richmond, Williamsburg, Ripley, Batavia, Augusta, Felicity, Withamsville, Owensville, Hamersville, Higginsport, Moscow, Neville, Chilo, Willow Grove, Bradford and Saltair. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
